The tax cuts will not be allowed to expire. The expiration is simply a procedural requirement. Again, the bill does not make any changes to Medicare or Medicaid. Anyone who says it does is being disingenuous.

The tax bill does not make any changes to Medicare. It will also greatly benefit the people of Southwest Alabama. The bill actually delivers the largest percentage reductions in taxes paid for low- and middle-income Americans.

The new clinic will provide space for primary care, audiology, education, eye clinics, mental health, radiology, and women's health.

Q about immigration: Any immigration reform plan must start with border security. #SolutionsTour
Q about #Obamacare: The deductibles are so high that many people have effectively been rendered uninsured. #SolutionsTour

Learn more about our nation's spending problems and my ideas for reforming means based entitlement programs here: https://byrne.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/byrne-supports-regulatory-reform-legislation …
We should reform these programs to ensure they are actually helping people rise out of poverty instead of keeping them there.
In 2012, the government spent almost $800 billion on over 92 different programs aimed at lifting Americans out of poverty. They didn't work.
If we are ever going to get our spending under control, we should start by reforming our means based entitlement programs.
The real driver of our #NationalDebt is mandatory spending. These are programs that are not subject to the annual appropriations process.
My grandson, MacGuire, is about to turn one and already his share of the #NationalDebt – before his first birthday – is over $40,000.
Today I outlined how our nation's #spending crisis is putting the next generation at risk. WATCH:https://youtu.be/J48wem5gHXI
I'll be speaking on the House floor in the next few minutes about our out-of-control spending. WATCH LIVE: http://houselive.gov/

I call on the President to stand up and quit trying to bargain with the Congress by holding defense spending hostage.
The President needs to realize he cannot be the Commander-in-Chief our armed forces need if he is using them as a budgetary bargaining chip.
However, I am appalled the President would insist that any increase in defense spending should be matched w/ increases in domestic programs.
I agree with President Obama that we are at war w/ Islamic terrorists and Congress should eliminate senseless cuts to defense spending.
